item.title: Morgan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "The world is Trouble...and Grace. That is all there is." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Morgan add a quote by M.T. Anderson
item.description: "At long last, you may no longer distinguish what binds you from what is you." -- M.T. Anderson

item.title: Morgan add a quote by M.T. Anderson
item.description: "Empedocles claims that in utero, our backbone is one long solid; and that through the constriction of the womb and the punishments of birth it must be snapped again and again to form our vertebrae; that for the child to have a spine, his back must first be broken." -- M.T. Anderson

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "Books swept me away, this way and that, one after the other; I made endless vows according to their lights for I believed them." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone ought to be." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Look for God. Look for God like a man with his head on fire looks for water." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Never forget that once upon a time, in an unguarded moment, you recognized yourself as a friend." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "There's no trouble in this world so serious that it can't be cured with a hot bath, a glass of whiskey, and the Book of Common Prayer." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Kabir
item.description: "All know that the drop merges into the ocean, but few know that the ocean merges into the drop." -- Kabir

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "Bruises mapped my body from bumping into tables and tripping over curbs while walking with a book in my hand, my eyes focused on the pages instead of the live space around me." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "No matter what happens, there is always the business of the world to attend to." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "And what will I be able to do tomorrow that I cannot yet do today?" -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "The world turns and the world spins, the tide runs in and the tide runs out, and there is nothing in the world more beautiful and more wonderful in all its evolved forms than two souls who look at each other straight on. And there is nothing more woeful and soul-saddening than when they are parted...everything in the world rejoices in the touch, and everything in the world laments in the losing." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Scott Douglas
item.description: "The library—the place in my life that was full of books—beagan to teach me that books weren't everything." -- Scott Douglas

item.title: Morgan add a quote by bob graham
item.description: "A loose feather can't be put back...but a broken wing can sometimes heal." -- bob graham

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Morgan add a quote by F.E. Higgins
item.description: "What is life if not a gamble?" -- F.E. Higgins

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "‎And yet I have had the weakness, and have still the weakness, to wish you to know with what a sudden mastery you kindled me, heap of ashes that I am, into fire." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "Mr. Powell raised an eyebrow. 'I'm a librarian,' he said. 'I always know what I'm talking about." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Louise Bogan
item.description: "O remember In your narrowing dark hours That more things move Than blood in the heart." -- Louise Bogan

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Morgan add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman
